verses.verse: My soul<WH5315> is weary<WH5354> of my life;<WH2416> I will leave<WH5800> my complaint<WH7879> upon<WH5921> myself; I will speak<WH1696> in the bitterness<WH4751> of my soul.<WH5315>
I will say<WH559> unto<WH413> God,<WH433> Do not<WH408> condemn<WH7561> me; show<WH3045> me wherefore<WH5921> <WH4100> thou contendest<WH7378> with me.

Is it good<WH2896> unto thee that<WH3588> thou shouldest oppress,<WH6231> that<WH3588> thou shouldest despise<WH3988> the work<WH3018> of thine hands,<WH3709> and shine<WH3313> upon<WH5921> the counsel<WH6098> of the wicked?<WH7563>
Hast thou eyes<WH5869> of flesh?<WH1320> or<WH518> seest<WH7200> thou as man<WH582> seeth?<WH7200>
Are thy days<WH3117> as the days<WH3117> of man?<WH582> are thy years<WH8141> as man's<WH1397> days,<WH3117>
That <WH3588> thou inquirest<WH1245> after mine iniquity,<WH5771> and searchest<WH1875> after my sin?<WH2403>
Thou knowest<WH1847> that<WH3588> I am not<WH3808> wicked;<WH7561> and there is none<WH369> that can deliver<WH5337> out of thine hand.<WH4480> <WH3027>
Thine hands<WH3027> have made<WH6087> me and fashioned<WH6213> me together<WH3162> round about;<WH5439> yet thou dost destroy<WH1104> me.
Remember, <WH2142> I beseech thee,<WH4994> that<WH3588> thou hast made<WH6213> me as the clay;<WH2563> and wilt thou bring me into dust again?<WH7725> <WH413> <WH6083>
Hast thou not<WH3808> poured me out<WH5413> as milk,<WH2461> and curdled<WH7087> me like cheese?<WH1385>
Thou hast clothed<WH3847> me with skin<WH5785> and flesh,<WH1320> and hast fenced<WH7753> me with bones<WH6106> and sinews.<WH1517>
Thou hast granted<WH6213> <WH5978> me life<WH2416> and favor,<WH2617> and thy visitation<WH6486> hath preserved<WH8104> my spirit.<WH7307>
And these<WH428> things hast thou hid<WH6845> in thine heart:<WH3824> I know<WH3045> that<WH3588> this<WH2063> is with<WH5973> thee.
If <WH518> I sin,<WH2398> then thou markest<WH8104> me, and thou wilt not<WH3808> acquit<WH5352> me from mine iniquity.<WH4480> <WH5771>

If <WH518> I be wicked,<WH7561> woe<WH480> unto me; and if I be righteous,<WH6663> yet will I not<WH3808> lift up<WH5375> my head.<WH7218> I am full<WH7649> of confusion;<WH7036> therefore see<WH7200> thou mine affliction;<WH6040>
For it increaseth.<WH1342> Thou huntest<WH6679> me as a fierce lion:<WH7826> and again<WH7725> thou showest thyself marvelous<WH6381> upon me.
Thou renewest<WH2318> thy witnesses<WH5707> against<WH5048> me, and increasest<WH7235> thine indignation<WH3708> upon<WH5973> me; changes<WH2487> and war<WH6635> are against<WH5973> me.
Wherefore <WH4100> then hast thou brought me forth<WH3318> out of the womb?<WH4480> <WH7358> Oh that I had given up the ghost,<WH1478> and no<WH3808> eye<WH5869> had seen<WH7200> me!
I should have been<WH1961> as though<WH834> I had not<WH3808> been;<WH1961> I should have been carried<WH2986> from the womb<WH4480> <WH990> to the grave.<WH6913>
Are not<WH3808> my days<WH3117> few?<WH4592> cease<WH2308> then, and let me alone,<WH7896> <WH4480> that I may take comfort<WH1082> a little,<WH4592>
Before <WH2962> I go<WH1980> whence I shall not<WH3808> return,<WH7725> even to<WH413> the land<WH776> of darkness<WH2822> and the shadow of death;<WH6757>
A land<WH776> of darkness,<WH5890> as<WH3644> darkness<WH652> itself; and of the shadow of death,<WH6757> without<WH3808> any order,<WH5468> and where the light<WH3313> is as<WH3644> darkness.<WH652>
